verses.verse: And there went<WH1980> a man<WH376> of the house<WH4480> <WH1004> of Levi,<WH3878> and took<WH3947> to wife a<WH853> daughter<WH1323> of Levi.<WH3878>

And the woman<WH802> conceived,<WH2029> and bore<WH3205> a son:<WH1121> and when she saw<WH7200> him that<WH3588> he<WH1931> was a goodly<WH2896> child, she hid<WH6845> him three<WH7969> months.<WH3391>

And when she could<WH3201> not<WH3808> longer<WH5750> hide<WH6845> him, she took<WH3947> for him an ark<WH8392> of bulrushes,<WH1573> and daubed<WH2560> it with slime<WH2564> and with pitch,<WH2203> and put<WH7760> <WH853> the child<WH3206> therein; and she laid<WH7760> it in the flags<WH5488> by<WH5921> the river's<WH2975> brink.<WH8193>
And his sister<WH269> stood<WH3320> afar off,<WH4480> <WH7350> to know<WH3045> what<WH4100> would be done<WH6213> to him.

And the daughter<WH1323> of Pharaoh<WH6547> came down<WH3381> to wash<WH7364> herself at<WH5921> the river;<WH2975> and her maidens<WH5291> walked along<WH1980> by<WH5921> the river's<WH2975> side;<WH3027> and when she saw<WH7200> <WH853> the ark<WH8392> among<WH8432> the flags,<WH5488> she sent<WH7971> <WH853> her maid<WH519> to fetch<WH3947> it.

And when she had opened<WH6605> it, she saw<WH7200> <WH853> the child:<WH3206> and, behold,<WH2009> the babe<WH5288> wept.<WH1058> And she had compassion<WH2550> on<WH5921> him, and said,<WH559> This<WH2088> is one of the Hebrews' children.<WH4480> <WH3206> <WH5680>

Then said<WH559> his sister<WH269> to<WH413> Pharaoh's<WH6547> daughter,<WH1323> Shall I go<WH1980> and call<WH7121> to thee a nurse<WH802> <WH3243> of<WH4480> the Hebrew women,<WH5680> that she may nurse<WH3243> <WH853> the child<WH3206> for thee?
And Pharaoh's<WH6547> daughter<WH1323> said<WH559> to her, Go.<WH1980> And the maid<WH5959> went<WH1980> and called<WH7121> the child's<WH3206> <WH853> mother.<WH517>

And Pharaoh's<WH6547> daughter<WH1323> said<WH559> unto her, Take this child away,<WH1980> <WH853> <WH2088> <WH3206> and nurse<WH3243> it for me, and I<WH589> will give<WH5414> thee<WH853> thy wages.<WH7939> And the woman<WH802> took<WH3947> the child,<WH3206> and nursed<WH5134> it.

And the child<WH3206> grew,<WH1431> and she brought<WH935> him unto Pharaoh's<WH6547> daughter,<WH1323> and he became<WH1961> her son.<WH1121> And she called<WH7121> his name<WH8034> Moses:<WH4872> and she said,<WH559> Because<WH3588> I drew<WH4871> him out of<WH4480> the water.<WH4325>

And it came to pass<WH1961> in those<WH1992> days,<WH3117> when Moses<WH4872> was grown,<WH1431> that he went out<WH3318> unto<WH413> his brethren,<WH251> and looked<WH7200> on their burdens:<WH5450> and he spied<WH7200> an Egyptian<WH376> <WH4713> smiting<WH5221> a Hebrew,<WH376> <WH5680> one of his brethren.<WH4480> <WH251>

And he looked<WH6437> this way<WH3541> and that way,<WH3541> and when he saw<WH7200> that<WH3588> there was no<WH369> man,<WH376> he slew<WH5221> <WH853> the Egyptian,<WH4713> and hid<WH2934> him in the sand.<WH2344>

And when he went out<WH3318> the second<WH8145> day,<WH3117> behold,<WH2009> two<WH8147> men<WH376> of the Hebrews<WH5680> strove together:<WH5327> and he said<WH559> to him that did the wrong,<WH7563> Wherefore<WH4100> smitest<WH5221> thou thy fellow?<WH7453>

And he said,<WH559> Who<WH4310> made<WH7760> thee a prince<WH8269> and a judge<WH8199> over<WH5921> us? intendest<WH559> thou<WH859> to kill<WH2026> me, as<WH834> thou killedst<WH2026> <WH853> the Egyptian?<WH4713> And Moses<WH4872> feared,<WH3372> and said,<WH559> Surely<WH403> this thing<WH1697> is known.<WH3045>

Now when Pharaoh<WH6547> heard<WH8085> this<WH2088> <WH853> thing,<WH1697> he sought<WH1245> to slay<WH2026> <WH853> Moses.<WH4872> But Moses<WH4872> fled<WH1272> from the face<WH4480> <WH6440> of Pharaoh,<WH6547> and dwelt<WH3427> in the land<WH776> of Midian:<WH4080> and he sat down<WH3427> by<WH5921> a well.<WH875>

Now the priest<WH3548> of Midian<WH4080> had seven<WH7651> daughters:<WH1323> and they came<WH935> and drew<WH1802> water, and filled<WH4390> <WH853> the troughs<WH7298> to water<WH8248> their father's<WH1> flock.<WH6629>
And the shepherds<WH7462> came<WH935> and drove them away:<WH1644> but Moses<WH4872> stood up<WH6965> and helped<WH3467> them, and watered<WH8248> <WH853> their flock.<WH6629>
And when they came<WH935> to<WH413> Reuel<WH7467> their father,<WH1> he said,<WH559> How<WH4069> is it that ye are come<WH935> so soon<WH4116> today?<WH3117>

And they said,<WH559> An Egyptian<WH376> <WH4713> delivered<WH5337> us out of the hand<WH4480> <WH3027> of the shepherds,<WH7462> and also<WH1571> drew water enough<WH1802> <WH1802> for us, and watered<WH8248> <WH853> the flock.<WH6629>

And he said<WH559> unto<WH413> his daughters,<WH1323> And where<WH346> is he? why<WH4100> is it<WH2088> that ye have left<WH5800> <WH853> the man?<WH376> call<WH7121> him, that he may eat<WH398> bread.<WH3899>
And Moses<WH4872> was content<WH2974> to dwell<WH3427> with<WH854> the man:<WH376> and he gave<WH5414> Moses<WH4872> <WH853> Zipporah<WH6855> his daughter.<WH1323>

And she bore<WH3205> him a son,<WH1121> and he called<WH7121> <WH853> his name<WH8034> Gershom:<WH1648> for<WH3588> he said,<WH559> I have been<WH1961> a stranger<WH1616> in a strange<WH5237> land.<WH776>

And it came to pass<WH1961> in process of time,<WH3117> <WH7227> <WH1992> that the king<WH4428> of Egypt<WH4714> died:<WH4191> and the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> sighed<WH584> by reason of<WH4480> the bondage,<WH5656> and they cried,<WH2199> and their cry<WH7775> came up<WH5927> unto<WH413> God<WH430> by reason of<WH4480> the bondage.<WH5656>

And God<WH430> heard<WH8085> <WH853> their groaning,<WH5009> and God<WH430> remembered<WH2142> <WH853> his covenant<WH1285> with<WH854> Abraham,<WH85> with<WH854> Isaac,<WH3327> and with<WH854> Jacob.<WH3290>
And God<WH430> looked upon<WH7200> <WH853> the children<WH1121> of Israel,<WH3478> and God<WH430> had respect<WH3045> unto them.
